pkgmetadata.longdescription: Disaster Victim Identification // Joint DNA-based disaster victim identification (DVI), as described in Vigeland and Egeland (2021) doi:10.21203/rs.3.rs-296414/v1. Joint Victim identification is performed by optimising the joint likelihood of all genotyped individuals. Individual identification probabilities, conditional on all available information, are derived from the joint solution in the form of posterior pairing probabilities. 'dvir' is part of the 'ped suite' ecosystem for pedigree analysis, and relies in particular on 'forrel' for computation of likelihood ratios.
